kizuna_history_a_02:
The way you conduct yourself in my class and
the answers you give to my questions...[npcn:27]
kizuna_history_a_03:
I admit they pique my interest. You are quite the
interesting pupil, I must say.[npcn:27]
kizuna_history_a_04:
[BD06:0]Tell me, [trnm:0]—given a
choice,\r
which\r
do\r
you\r
prefer?\c
Things of old? Or things that are new?[npcn:27]
kizuna_history_a_05:
You would answer “new stuff” to me, your history
teacher? Ha! You really are a curious one.[npcn:27]
kizuna_history_a_06:
Ah. So you prefer the things of the past, do you?
The potential I saw in you was real after all.[npcn:27]
kizuna_history_a_07:
Yes, this one may indeed be of good use to
me someday...[npcn:27]
kizuna_history_a_08:
Ah, you can disregard that. I was simply thinking
out loud.[npcn:27]
kizuna_history_a_09:
I enjoyed our little conversation today. You have
my thanks, [trnm:0].[npcn:27]
kizuna_history_a_system_01: You became slightly closer with Ms. Raifort!
